1.text: Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I have given order to the churches of Galatia, even so do ye.

2.text: Upon the first day of the week, let every one of you lay by him in store, as God hath prospered him, that there be no collections when I come.

3.text: And when I come, whomsoever ye shall approve by your letters, them will I send to bring your liberality to Jerusalem.

4.text: And if it be proper that I should go also, they shall go with me.

5.text: Now I will come to you, when I shall pass through Macedonia: for I am to pass through Macedonia.

6.text: And it may be that I shall abide, and even winter with you, that ye may bring me on my journey whithersoever I go.

7.text: For I will not see you now by the way; but I trust to tarry a while with you, if the Lord permit.

8.text: But I shall tarry at Ephesus until Pentecost.

9.text: For a great door and effectual is opened to me, and there are many adversaries.

10.text: Now if Timothy come, see that he may be with you without fear: for he worketh the work of the Lord, as I also do.

11.text: Let no man therefore despise him: but conduct him forth in peace, that he may come to me: for I look for him with the brethren.

12.text: As concerning our brother Apollos, I greatly desired him to come to you with the brethren: but his will was not at all to come at this time; but he will come when he shall have convenient time.

13.text: Watch ye, stand fast in the faith, acquit yourselves like men, be strong.

14.text: Let all your things be done with charity.

15.text: I beseech you, brethren, (ye know the house of Stephanas, that it is the first fruits of Achaia, and that they have addicted themselves to the ministry of the saints,)

16.text: That ye submit yourselves to such, and to every one that helpeth with us, and laboreth.

17.text: I am glad of the coming of Stephanas, and Fortunatus, and Achaicus: for that which was lacking on your part, they have supplied.

18.text: For they have refreshed my spirit and yours: therefore acknowledge ye them that are such.

19.text: The churches of Asia salute you. Aquila and Priscilla salute you much in the Lord, with the church that is in their house.

20.text: All the brethren greet you. Greet ye one another with a holy kiss.

21.text: The salutation of me Paul with my own hand.

22.text: If any man loveth not the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be Anathema, Maran-atha.

23.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.

24.text: My love be with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen.
